case_vignette: THE PATIENT IS A 21-YEAR-OLD MALE WHO PRESENTS FOR CONTINUED ACNE THERAPY. HE HAS HAD SEVERE ACNE ON HIS FACE, CHEST, AND BACK FOR YEARS. HE IS HAPPY WITH HIS CURRENT ACNE REGIMEN OF TOPICAL TRETINOIN, TOPICAL CLINDAMYCIN, AND ORAL MINOCYCLINE. HE HAS BEEN ON THE REGIMEN FOR YEARS. ON EXAMINATION, YOU NOTICE SIGNIFICANT BLUE-BLACK DISCOLORATION CONFINED TO SITES OF PREVIOUS ACNE SCARS. THE PATIENT HAS NO OTHER MEDICAL PROBLEMS AND NO RELEVANT SOCIAL OR FAMILY HISTORY.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have significant blue-black discoloration on my acne scars.
How long have you been experiencing this discoloration on your acne scars?
I have been experiencing this discoloration for years.
Have you received any treatments or used any medications for your acne or discoloration before?
Yes, I have been using topical tretinoin, topical clindamycin, and oral minocycline for my acne.
Do you have a history of any hormonal issues or disorders?
No, I do not have any hormonal issues or disorders.
Have you noticed if the discoloration worsens with sun exposure?
I haven't noticed any change in the discoloration with sun exposure.
Do any of your family members have similar skin issues or a history of skin conditions?
No, my family does not have a history of similar skin issues or conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Post-inflammatory hyperpigmentation.

trial_0.singleturn_mcq: Final Diagnosis: Type II minocycline hyperpigmentation
